title: 好书推荐｜要懂强化学习就要看《强化学习的数学原理》
summary: 强化学习是大模型和智能体的核心理论基础之一，其重要性不言而喻。为什么大家觉得强化学习难学？根本原因是强化学习包含了广泛的数学理论。具体而言，主要包含了概率论、统计学、随机过程、最优化理论、微积分、线性

title: 强化学习SB3基础（一）从基础框架开始
summary: 一、基本框架概述强化学习使用 Stable-Baselines3 库的基本步骤如下：1. 定义环境：创建一个自定义环境类，继承自 gym.Wrapper，用于封装原始环境。2. 创建/导入模型：使用 PPO 等算法创建模型，或从文件加载已有模型。

title: SKYRL-AGENT：多轮 LLM 智能体的高效强化学习训练革命
summary: 在 r2e-gym 的 4.5k 任务实例上进行纯强化学习训练，最终在 swe-bench verified 基准测试中达到 39.4% 的 pass@1 成绩（采用仅含文件编辑器与 bash 工具的简化 react 循环，40k 上下文长度，100 步最大迭代）。

title: 别再只会写 API 了！C# 开发者该学的下一个技能：Agentic AI

title: 编码器与解码器：大模型“理解”与“创造”的双翼

title: 腾讯混元数字人团队发布Moral RolePlay基准，揭秘大模型的「道德困境」
summary: moral roleplay 对 18 个主流模型进行了大规模评估，结果显示：可以看到：整体表现从 Level 1 的 3.21 分降到 Level 4 的 2.62 分，下降趋势明显。最大跌幅在 Level 2 到 Level 3（-0.43 分），说明「自私」行为是模型的痛点。

title: AI大模型，一直封神一直被骗

title: 有没有一种大模型，叫做 Large Experience Model？ ——关于语言模型、世界模型与体验模型的几个思考
summary: 近年来，大模型作为人工智能领域最重要的技术进展之一，正迅速改变着计算范式。Large Language Model（LLM）借由规模化的语料训练，使机器获得了前所未有的语言生成与理解能力，并被视为知识获取、意义推断和交互接口重塑的

title: 全球AI大模型集体竞速
summary: 虽然从技术顶底上，国内在极大规模训练平台、开源生态、数据基础设施、算法成熟度上与欧美领先者存在差距，但今年国内大模型也迎来爆发期，百度、MiniMax、Kimi等厂商形成“大厂引领+创业公司突围”的格局。

title: 几年内，大模型如何重塑软件研发的边界与本质？
summary: 也就是说，大模型的创新能力有限（我们也不能说，大模型没有创新能力）。今天，大模型（如Claude 4 think或Gemini 2.5 pro等）已能基于提示词生成比较完整的代码函数或应用程序。

title: Memori
summary: Memori (GitHub Repo) Memori, an open-source SQL-Native memory engine, allows LLMs to remember conversations and maintain context using standard SQL databases with the simple addition of "memori.enable()". The tool works with existing SQL databases and LLM frameworks through LiteLLM's callback system, using modes like Conscious, Auto, and Combined for context injection and recording.

title: Openspec
summary: Openspec (GitHub Repo) OpenSpec aligns AI coding assistants and human developers with spec-driven development so teams can agree on what to build before writing code. The framework adds a specification workflow that locks intent before implementation, ensuring deterministic and reviewable outputs without needing API keys.

title: A closer look at Python Workflows, now in beta
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-21, Reading time: 5 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fblog.cloudflare.com%2Fpython-workflows%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdevops/1/0100019aa64e93c2-c4020d30-56c2-42af-83fb-03383631349b-000000/y3M3ggXTwEbr40Hiy3AOWAyumBEJMKrD5MRZk-kpxhc=432
summary: A closer look at Python Workflows, now in beta (5 minute read) Cloudflare has introduced Python Workflows, bringing full parity with JavaScript Workflows and enabling developers to build multi-step applications directly in Python on Cloudflare Workers. Workflows automate sequences of idempotent steps with built-in retries, durable state, and error handling, which now leverage Python's strength in data pipelines, AI/ML orchestration, and task automation.

title: 3 strategies that reduce security friction in developer workflows
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-21, Reading time: 6 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.hashicorp.com%2Fen%2Fblog%2F3-strategies-that-reduce-security-friction-in-developer-workflows%3Futm_source=tldrdevops/1/0100019aa64e93c2-c4020d30-56c2-42af-83fb-03383631349b-000000/GcVOjE6R0NGLebZvJ7w0Os-GXekLefpO8KzAbFQhCEw=432
summary: 3 strategies that reduce security friction in developer workflows (6 minute read) Security is evolving from control to collaboration by embedding safeguards directly into developer workflows through automation and real-time feedback. Teams can reduce friction by integrating early security scanning in developer tools, replacing enforcement with in-workflow enablement, and building continuous visibility through IDE guidance, ecosystem monitoring, and centralized secrets management.

title: 5 marketing planning thought experiments
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-21, Reading time: 10 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fnewsletter.mkt1.co%2Fp%2Fmarketing-thought-experiments%3Futm_source=tldrmarketing/1/0100019aa64ed77f-3127708f-4b5e-492a-bb00-686d95eb272e-000000/PNlWmArld0Iazt7qQjyehhT2Dsyee62Pqj_oDF9nUHQ=432
summary: 5 marketing planning thought experiments (10 minute read) Using thought experiments can shake up defaults and spark fresh ideas. Teams can explore growing with existing content and driving growth from current leads without adding new accounts. They can test differentiation if a competitor copied the product or if it went free. Binary choices reveal true priorities, and imagining a dream speaker clarifies brand narrative. These exercises can help reveal blind spots.

title: Speak loudly to close more sales
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-21, Reading time: 3 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fapp.sciencesays.com%2Fp%2Fspeak-loudly-to-close-more-sales%3Futm_source=tldrmarketing/1/0100019aa64ed77f-3127708f-4b5e-492a-bb00-686d95eb272e-000000/0z01yrmaxAF4OUTM0SMF_8_hWTpoBWoqHokRCDO37f4=432
summary: Speak loudly to close more sales (3 minute read) A loud tone increases sales and speeds decisions for both new and returning customers. New customers respond best to a loud, energetic voice, which raises purchase likelihood by up to 8% and makes the salesperson seem 26.7% more excited. Returning customers respond best to a loud but calm tone, which raises purchase likelihood by 5.4% and boosts perceived competence by 4.8%. Energetic tones reduce purchase likelihood for returning customers by 3%.

title: Guideflow
summary: Guideflow (Tool) Guideflow is a demo automation platform that helps teams build product walkthroughs in minutes using a no-code builder. It captures apps or sites, generates step-by-step guides, adds personalization, and applies AI for polishing, translations, and voiceovers. Demos can be embedded or shared across channels and tracked through analytics.

title: The Great LinkedIn Reach Drop: What Changed and How to Fix It
summary: The Great LinkedIn Reach Drop: What Changed and How to Fix It (Webinar) This webinar explains the recent drop in LinkedIn reach and how the algorithm has shifted. Ex-LinkedIn insider Alicia Teltz shares data from platform reports and top creators, covering what the algorithm now prioritizes, which post formats perform, and which habits reduce visibility.

summary: A/B Testing: The Science of Not Fooling Yourself (6 minute read) Most reported results in research are unreliable because many claims come from weak observational studies and fail to replicate in controlled experiments. A/B tests remain the most trustworthy way to establish causality, yet even statistically significant results can be false when success rates sit near 10% and multiple testing infl...
